results.title: No love for Johnnie
results.creator_credit: Ralph Thomas, Betty E. Box and General Film Distributors
results.brief_description: Johnnie Byrne (Peter Finch) is a man with the political ambition to ascend to number one in the Northern country industrial town in which he was raised. Although his party is successful and is voted into office, Johnnie is overlooked for selection. Returning home, dejected, he discovers his wife, Alice had secret political ideas of her own and has left Johnnie to pursue her own ambitions. He begins an affair with a photographers model, but this too, like his political career is absent of love. A strange turn of events sees Alice attempting to rekindle her relationship with Johnnie and his good fortune seems to continue as he is offered a position in cabinet. To Johnnies horror he discovers that the reason why he wasn’t offered the position before was because of Alice’s connections to the Communist Party and Johnnie must ultimately decide between love and his political ambition. Cast also includes Mary Peach, Stanley Holloway, Donald Pleasence and Billie Whitelaw.

results.title: Windom's way
results.creator_credit: Ronald Neame, John Bryan and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: Dr Alec Windom (Peter Finch) is a resident doctor on the island of Selim in South East Asia. He is a committed and dedicated doctor to both his patients and the wider community which is currently experiencing unrest. It is into this environment that Windom’s estranged wife, Lee (Mary Ure) arrives. Because of his prominent and respected position in society, Windom attempts to act as mediator between the exploited natives and the Government to prevent a native uprising but is thwarted by betrayal from the authorities. Disillusioned by his inability to reconcile the situation and by the betrayal that occurs, Windom prepares to leave the country with his wife. Cast also includes Natasha Parry, Robert Flemying, Michael Horderna and Marne Maitland. Based on a novel by James Ramsay Ullman.

results.title: The Big deal on Maddona Street = I soliti ignoto = Persons unknown = The usual unidentified thieves
results.creator_credit: Mario Monicelli, Franco Cristaldi and Lux Film
results.brief_description: This now classic Italian spoof on the caper film, about a group of incompetent amateur crooks who plan an elaborate but misguided robbery on a store, was hugely successful in both Italy and the United States. Primarily a take-off of Dassian’s ‘Rififi’ (1955), its comedy of errors is firmly rooted in social conditions of deprivation. Moncelli uses the conventions of the heist film to maximum effect and adds a steady stream of sight gags played out by an impeccable cast featuring Vittorio Gassman, Renato Salvatori, Claudia Cardinale and Marcello Mastroianni, with hilarious results. The jazz score by Piero Umiliani is also notable. From a story by Age Scarpelli. Credits: Director, Mario Monicelli ; writers, Age Scarpelli, Suso Cecchi D’amico, Mario Monicelli ; photography, Erico Menczer ; music, Piero Umiliani. Nominated for an Oscar for Best Foreign Film in 1958.

results.title: Who dares wins
results.creator_credit: Ian Sharp, Euan Lloyd and Sturia Leasing Ltd
results.brief_description: Judy Davis stars in a controversial role as the leader of an anti-nuclear terrorist group. They are planning to attack the American Embassy residence in London to draw attention to their cause. Lewis Collins, posing as a court martialled S.A.S. Captain joins the terrorists in their attack on the embassy and subsequent kidnapping. Once housed in the embassy, Collins commences a combined air and ground attack on the S.A.S. The lives of the hostages are at stake as the S.A.S begin their rescue operation. Also starring Edward Woodwood and based on an original story by George Markstein.

results.title: Tales of terror
results.creator_credit: Roger Corman and Alta Vista Productions
results.brief_description: Presented on this tape are three classic tales from the master of mystery and imagination, Edgar Allan Poe, featuring Vincent Price, Peter Lorre and Basil Rathbone. MORELLA; A tormented spirit raises from the dead to seek revenge; THE BLACK CAT; A jealous husband is pursued by a black cat after he entombs his unfaithful wife and her lover; THE CASE OF M. VALDEMAR; A dying man and a crazed doctor become involved in an experiment to delay death. Also starring Debra Paget.

results.title: Something to hide
results.brief_description: Harry Field’s (Peter Finch) life is turned into a nightmare when he offers a hitch-hiker (Linda Hayden) a lift. His problems are exacerbated by marital problems and alcoholism. Also starring Shelley Winters, Colin Blakely, John Stride and Linda Hayden. Also known as “Shattered” and based on the book by Nicholas Monsarrat.

results.title: Pirates of Spring Cove
results.creator_credit: Richard Thorpe, Alan Brown and Duota Rentals
results.brief_description: Hayley Mills and John Mills star in this family pleaser that has adventure, piracy, buried treasure and romance. An American widower and his 18 year old daughter live on a Caribbean houseboat. When they invite the nephew of a millionaire to join them on their voyage, romance and action hop on board too. The nephew’s former business partner arrives and together they embark on a dive to discover buried treasure. James MacArthur (Hawaii Five-O) co stars. Also known as “The Truth about Spring”, after Hayley Mills’ character, Spring Tyler.

results.title: The Dead zone
results.creator_credit: David Cronenberg, Debra Hill, Columbia Pictures and Rastar Productions
results.brief_description: Faithfully adapted from the Stephen King novel of the same name, this is the chilling story of a man who wakes up from a five-year coma with the extraordinary power to see visions of the past, present and, most frightening, the future. A tense and thought provoking production in which Walken gives one of his most intense and believable performances.

results.title: The Stepfather
results.creator_credit: Joseph Ruben, Jay Benson and ITC Productions
results.brief_description: Terry O’Quinn is “the Stepfather”, the man with the generic name because he has been a stepfather many times. He also has a gruesome way of ending relationships and severing the family ties; he kills them when they fail to meet his perfect standards and moves on to the next family. Shelley Hack and Jill Schoelen are cast as his latest victims.

results.title: The Big lift
results.creator_credit: George Seaton and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Montgomery Clift and Paul Douglas star in this reenactment of the Berlin airlift of 1948 which occurred as a result of a Russian blockade of the western sector; refusing to allow the Allies to ship food supplies to starving Berliners. An airlift proves to be the only solution. Paul Douglas stars as ground operations sergeant Frank Kowalski, and Montgomery Clift as pilot Danny MacCullough, both of whom have differing views on the matter. Cornell Borchers features as a love interest.
